alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Mitchell; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN DECATUR...NORTHERN GRADY...SOUTHERN MITCHELL AND NORTHWESTERN THOMAS COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Whigham, or 13 miles west of Pelham, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Pelham, Vada, Akridge, Grady Co A/p, Peoples Still, Spence, Capel, Elpino, Quality, Branchville, and Harrells Still. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
